artist: Artist: Wu Changshuo; Calligrapher: Zhang Bingling
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: fan with calligraphy on one side and painting of flowering tree branch, with brown, red and yellow flowers, on other side; one area of text on painting side
markings: three stamps, two on calligraphy side, one on painting side, in red; sticker, on top edge of one long wood end piece
medium: Ink and color on paper, wood
text:
The pomegranates represent vigorous fertility because of the fruit's numerous seeds--a pun implying sons. The image in art, therefore, is imbued with a good wish for numerous offspring.

The playful poem reads: 

 While eating pearl-like pomegranate seeds
I also throw the seeds at sparrows
I painted this at age 83.
title: Pomegranates
